author: Daily News staff
title: Bucs’ Wieseman earns HM All-America
text: Bucs’ Wieseman earns HM All-America By Daily News staff beloitdailynews.com | 0 comments BELOIT — Lana Wieseman, a senior on the Beloit College women’s basketball team from Lake Geneva, Wis., has earned Preseason Honorable Mention All-American laurels from Women’s DIII News, a monthly publication covering NCAA Division III women’s basketball Wieseman, a First Team All-Midwest Conference selection in 2014-15 after earning Second Team honors in 2013-14, led the Bucs in scoring (20.3), rebounding (8.6) and blocked shots (1.7) during the last season while recording nine double-doubles. She shot 50.6% (163-322) from the field, 81.6% (129-158) from the free throw line and 25.5% (13-51) from three-point. Her 468 points broke the all-time Beloit Women’s record by 27 points while her scoring average ranked third all-time. She set the single-game scoring mark in the home finale against Monmouth College on Feb. 14, pouring in 37 points. It was her second 30-point game of the season, joining her 30-point effort at Cornell College on Dec. 18. She also had the fourth-most rebounds in a game in Beloit history with 18 against Lake Forest on Jan. 21. Wieseman became the 15th Buccaneer women’s basketball player, and just the third junior, to score 1,000 points when she hit the milestone on Jan. 21 at Lake Forest College. She finished the season with 1,164 career points, seventh on the all-time list. Heading into her senior season she ranks second in career scoring average at 16.9 ppg; third in free throws made with 298; and fifth in blocked shots with 84. The Bucs open their 2015-16 season on Nov, 13 at Loras College.
